DataElement.preferredName: Bilateral Testicular Cancer Diagnosis Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date Day Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from the date of initial pathologic diagnosis to the date of bilateral testicular cancer diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bilateral Testicular Cancer Diagnosis Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs._A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the testis.  Representative examples include fibroma, thecoma, benign Sertoli cell tumor, seminoma, embryonal carcinoma, sarcoma, leukemia, and lymphoma._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The act of removing a part from the whole._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.:A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the testis. Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the testis.  Representative examples include fibroma, thecoma, benign Sertoli cell tumor, seminoma, embryonal carcinoma, sarcoma, leukemia, and lymphoma.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The act of removing a part from the whole.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Testicular enrollment form per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 11/27/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.
